Description: Years of potential life lost before age 75 per 100,000 population (age-adjusted).
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Percentage of adults reporting fair or poor health (age-adjusted).
Average number of physically unhealthy days reported in past 30 days (age-adjusted).
Average number of mentally unhealthy days reported in past 30 days (age-adjusted).
Percentage of live births with low birthweight (< 2,500 grams).
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Natality files

Description: Percentage of adults who are current smokers.
Percentage of the adult population (age 20 and older) that reports a body mass index (BMI) greater than or equal to 30 kg/m2.
Index of factors that contribute to a healthy food environment, from 0 (worst) to 10 (best).
Source: USDA Food Environment Atlas, Map the Meal Gap from Feeding America

Description: Percentage of adults age 20 and over reporting no leisure-time physical activity.
Percentage of population with adequate access to locations for physical activity.
Source: Business Analyst, Delorme map data, ESRI, & US Census Tigerline Files

Description: Percentage of adults reporting binge or heavy drinking.
Percentage of driving deaths with alcohol involvement.
Number of newly diagnosed chlamydia cases per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for HIV/AIDS, Viral Hepatitis, STD, and TB Prevention

Description: Number of births per 1,000 female population ages 15-19.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Natality files

Description: Percentage of population under age 65 without health insurance.
Ratio of population to primary care physicians.
Source: Area Health Resource File/American Medical Association

Description: Ratio of population to dentists.
Source: Area Health Resource File/National Provider Identification file

Description: Ratio of population to mental health providers.
Rate of hospital stays for ambulatory-care sensitive conditions per 100,000 Medicare enrollees.
Percentage of female Medicare enrollees ages 65-74 that received an annual mammography screening.
Percentage of fee-for-service (FFS) Medicare enrollees that had an annual flu vaccination.
Percentage of ninth-grade cohort that graduates in four years.
Percentage of adults ages 25-44 with some post-secondary education.
Percentage of population ages 16 and older unemployed but seeking work.
Percentage of people under age 18 in poverty.
Source: Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates

Description: Ratio of household income at the 80th percentile to income at the 20th percentile.
Percentage of children that live in a household headed by single parent.
Number of membership associations per 10,000 population.
Number of reported violent crime offenses per 100,000 population.
Number of deaths due to injury per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Average daily density of fine particulate matter in micrograms per cubic meter (PM2.5).
Indicator of the presence of health-related drinking water violations. 'Yes' indicates the presence of a violation, 'No' indicates no violation.
Percentage of households with at least 1 of 4 housing problems: overcrowding, high housing costs, lack of kitchen facilities, or lack of plumbing facilities.
Percentage of the workforce that drives alone to work.
Among workers who commute in their car alone, the percentage that commute more than 30 minutes.
Average number of years a person can expect to live.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of deaths among residents under age 75 per 100,000 population (age-adjusted).
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of deaths among children under age 18 per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of all infant deaths (within 1 year), per 1,000 live births.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Percentage of adults reporting 14 or more days of poor physical health per month.
Percentage of adults reporting 14 or more days of poor mental health per month.
Percentage of adults aged 20 and above with diagnosed diabetes.
Number of people aged 13 years and older living with a diagnosis of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for HIV/AIDS, Viral Hepatitis, STD, and TB Prevention

Description: Percentage of population who lack adequate access to food.
Percentage of population who are low-income and do not live close to a grocery store.
Number of drug poisoning deaths per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of motor vehicle crash deaths per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Percentage of adults who report fewer than 7 hours of sleep on average.
Percentage of adults under age 65 without health insurance.
Percentage of children under age 19 without health insurance.
Ratio of population to primary care providers other than physicians.
Percentage of teens and young adults ages 16-19 who are neither working nor in school.
Average grade level performance for 3rd graders on English Language Arts standardized tests
Average grade level performance for 3rd graders on math standardized tests
The income where half of households in a county earn more and half of households earn less.
Source: Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates

Measure: Children eligible for free or reduced price lunch
Description: Percentage of children enrolled in public schools that are eligible for free or reduced price lunch.
Index of dissimilarity where higher values indicate greater residential segregation between Black and White county residents.
Index of dissimilarity where higher values indicate greater residential segregation between non-White and White county residents.
Number of deaths due to homicide per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of deaths due to suicide per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of deaths due to firearms per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Rate of delinquency cases per 1,000 juveniles
Source: Easy Access to State and County Juvenile Court Case Counts

Description: Average traffic volume per meter of major roadways in the county.
Source: EJSCREEN: Environmental Justice Screening and Mapping Tool

Description: Percentage of occupied housing units that are owned.
Percentage of households that spend 50% or more of their household income on housing.
Resident population.
Percentage of population below 18 years of age.
Percentage of population ages 65 and older.
Percentage of population that is non-Hispanic Black or African American.
Percentage of population that is American Indian or Alaska Native.
Percentage of population that is Asian.
Percentage of population that is Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander.
Percentage of population that is Hispanic.
Percentage of population that is non-Hispanic White.
Percentage of population that is not proficient in English.
Percentage of population that is female.
Percentage of population living in a rural area.
